intro: Zaluzianskya elgonensis, commonly known as the Elgon lily, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Kenya and Uganda. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
